Title: Transfers or disclosures not authorised by Union law

Content.Description: Any judgment of a court or tribunal and any decision of an administrative authority of a third country requiring a controller or processor to transfer or disclose personal data may only be recognised or enforceable if based on an international agreement.

Conditions.Agreement: Must be based on an international agreement, such as a mutual legal assistance treaty.
Conditions.Validity: The agreement must be in force between the requesting third country and the Union or a Member State.
Conditions.Limitations: Without prejudice to other grounds for transfer pursuant to this Chapter.
